sentence.Network_en: It may even be possible to make computers the size of a pinhead one day.
sentence.Network_cn: 甚至有一天计算机都可能做成钉头那样大小。

sentence.Network_en: The woman is such a pinhead. Not a brain in her head.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个女人这等的愚蠢, 脑袋里一点脑子也不长.

sentence.Network_en: The doctor fastens the pinhead with rubberized fabric.
sentence.Network_cn: 医生用橡皮胶把针头固定下来.

encyclopedia.content: 英音：['pinhed]美音：['pɪn,hɛd] pin，针 head，头 pinhead，1.针头，也指细小的东西 You must not neglect anything even a pinhead. 2.【美俚】傻瓜 You pinhead! 你这个傻瓜！ pinheaded， 笨的， 愚蠢的， 傻的， 糊涂的 That pigheaded old man refused to cooperate with the neighbors. 那个愚蠢的的老头拒绝和邻居合作。

entry.def: A pinhead is the small metal or plastic part on the top of a pin.

example.ex: It may even be possible to make computers the size of a pinhead one day.
example.tran: 甚至有一天计算机都可能做成钉头那样大小。

entry.def: If you think someone is very stupid, you can say they are a pinhead .

example.ex: ...the pinheads with the money and connections.

auth_sentence.content: In reality, the stem cells are extracted after about five days, when the donated embryo is smaller than a pinhead.
